content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO profilu Thunderbirdu - zvolte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.
creator: Ansamb

content: assuming Windows, on old PC, - click help>troubleshootinginformation in thunderbird - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' - exit thunderbird - assuming the desired folders are in either a POP account or Local Folders , copy the Mail folder to external media - on new PC, create new Local Folders folders - highlight a new folder, rightclick and select the importexport options to import mbox - click one of the desired folders on the external media (IGNORE the .msf files) and click ok. - repeat for each folder

content:
This is not a Thunderbird issue, and you are well advised to work with a legitimate mailing service. Your mail is classified as spam or not spam by the recipient, so it's not your call. Generally, email providers do not like any of this because it can get their servers blacklisted. And even mailchimp can't protect you ( I once administered a large mailing list with mailchimp, with all subscribers having done two-step subscriptions, yet for approx 5 months almost 1/3 of recipients did not receive the mailings - which came from a government organization. )

Being an author myself, I respect your desire to reach people, but we cannot judge what is and isn't spam, and providing assistance in mass mailings would put us in that situation. But I wish you well. (And this is a personal opinion, not necessarily what the big wigs at Thunderbird might do.)

content:
If you forgot the primary password, you can reset Thunderbird, but you lose all account passwords in doing that, as a security precaution. You would then need to reenter the various account passwords.

Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression: 

  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")     and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_resetting-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird cannot do that because Thunderbird is not the email address provider, only the agent. Thunderbird only knows what the user provides to it.
creator: davidsk

content:
I've lost my password to log into Thunderbird.

You don't login into Thunderbird. You do login to your email provider's server via Thunderbird. Hence you cannot change your account password via Thunderbird. You'd have to login to your account via webmail, and change the password on the server.

There is no provision to change it, and it wasn't saved by Thunderbird password manager.

You can tell Thunderbird to remember your account password. If this is something you didn't do, you'll have to talk to your email provider about password reset options.
creator: christ1

content:
I have never seen this before, but I did locate a URL that indicates this has been a bitdefender problem for several years: https://community.bitdefender.com/en/discussion/93701/remove-anti-spam-toolbar-in-thunderbird The page also gives a possible solution, that being here: 

    Close Thunderbird     Open file explorer and navigate to: %APPDATA%/Thunderbird/Profiles/<your profile>/extensions/     Delete the "bdThunderbirdxx@bitdefender.com.xpi     Open Thunderbird, the extension is no longer present.

See if that works.
